poem:
**The Unread Bill**  

In the clatter of papers  
and clamor of voices,  
a signature falls—  
unseen,  
the ink on the unseen page  
dries unnoticed.  
Words unspoken,  
scaffolding of intentions,  
crumble quietly.  
From her desk,  
eyes wide,  
belated understanding blooms  
amidst the printed lines  
that drown in silence.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Marjorie Taylor Greene criticized for not reading Trump’s ‘big beautiful’ bill Republican firebrand Marjorie Taylor Greene has drawn widespread criticism from Democratic colleagues for admitting that not only did she not read Donald Trump’s tax and spending bill before voting for it, but she would have voted against it had she read thoroughly. Greene revealed she was unaware of a provision in Trump’s “one big beautiful bill” (OBBB) that would prevent states from regulating artificial". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
